message.body: Hey. I have an idea for software that monitors hardware health in real time and reports back to a central server if there are issues so a warranty claim
can be made. Does that seem quasi realistic to be done without vendor involvement?
A program that sends data to database on a server is possible. Someone needs to develop the backend logic that manages the database, hosts the server, etc.
I don't know enough about what data you're collecting though. What metrics are you using to determine hardware health?
By hardware, I assume you mean components inside some workstation and not PCBs or anything like that.
Mostly desktop computers
My goal is a self healing environment. In terms of future proofing, adopting it to a vdi setup
I'm not familiar with what VDI is. The constraint I see right now is the data that you want to send to the database.
Virtual desktop so thin clients talking to a server
You'll need to determine the metrics you want (CPU temp? Etc) and some formula that spits out whether it's healthy or not based off of that.
Does it seem like the first step in a self healing environment?
What's your vision for self healing with regards to faulty hardware?
How exactly does self healing occur?
Faulty hardware, determining ui flaws, and when added training is needed
For faulty hardware migrating to a healthy instance
For ui on internally developed systems bug tickets being training
And for those that are clueless info on needed training would be the big one I could think of
For solely the faulty hardware part, I think the first step would be to investigate automatic detection of faulty hardware.
If you can detect it automatically with your own software, then it should be relatively simple to just send it to a database.
From that point, how you handle that is limitless. In the most simple scenario, you have a record you can use for warranty claims.

ll it off
Interested?

I'm afraid I'm not so sure about my short term or long term goals right now.
I'm the only person on campus to be qualified and identified as getting it. It's extremely low odds, but my new and old management are backing me. I wo
uld have at least 4 years and I would put you at a level where you'd be significantly better off.
You and Tom will be patching my significant holes in skillset
I'm basically saying I can cut 1/3 of all it for a 700k a year investment

I appreciate you thinking highly of me, but I'm really not sure how I want to further my career right now.
If you pull it off, feel free to message me and I'll consider it, but I can't promise anything.
It's a long shot, but I don't want to shoot without my support system
Hopefully it turns into something
